main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tse.usermanagement

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tse.usermanagement.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a user with his userID, his role, his PIN & PUK and the number of retries he has for logging in. The PIN & PUK have to be provided as hashed PIN & PUK for this class and it is the responsibility of the calling class to ensure PIN & PUK are hashed and not stored in plain text.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    dpottkaemper
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        private User()
        private constructor for the sake of only persisting complete users

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String id,
            java.lang.String role,
            byte[] hashedPin,
            byte[] hashedPuk,
            short remainingPINRetries,
            short remainingPUKRetries)
        Normally used constructor for a user.
        Parameters:
        id - name of the user or application
        role - either Admin or TimeAdmin. This determines what the user can and cannot do
        hashedPin - the hashed PIN of the user
        hashedPuk - the hashed PUK of the user
        remainingPINRetries - how many retries that user still has for their PIN entry
        remainingPUKRetries - how many retries that user still has for their PUK entry

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The toString method for a user. It lists all contents of this user and gives them back as a pretty, readable String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(User u)
        Implementation of the equals method for users. Two users are the same, if they have the same user ID, the same role, the same PIN and the same PUK. The number of retries on either of them does not matter.
        Parameters:
        u - the user to be compared to this
        Returns:
        true, if they are equal. False otherwise.
